page.title: 08RESULTS OF TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: The group concluded that most traffic to Dover does not originate in Cantrtbury so the by-pass route is used more frequently than the A2 by people to travelling to and from the ports. Therefore local traffic tended to,use both the A2 and the A257 though the A257 was found to be slightly busier - probably because of the sizeable number of large villages close-by(such as Littlebourne, Wingham and Preston). Few foreign cars or lorries were observed partly because this is not a major industrial area. The tourists who come to Canterbury probably arrive by coach and the minority who come in their own cars are likely to be attracted to stay in the city rather than tour the surrounding villages. .
